intro: Micropera edanoi, commonly known as the Edanoi micropera, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth texture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered endangered and requires careful conservation efforts.
